methodology.framework: Comparative mythology + Human Design (I Ching-derived) + channelled cosmology cross-referenced with historical/astronomical material
academic_foundations: I Ching (64 hexagrams → 64 Human Design gates)
Modern channeled material (Edgar Cayce A.R.E. archive, Milanovich, Kenyon) with publisher attribution
Observable/astronomical references to Arcturus in antiquity
Jungian archetypal psychology and myth analysis
methodology.source_standards: Only publisher-backed sources with ISBN or stable imprint (A.R.E. Press / Cayce Foundation, university presses, Cambridge University Press, etc.), peer-reviewed/academic astronomy texts, and ancient texts with a named human translator and known publisher. Blogs, personal domains, spiritual-school marketing pages, Wikipedia, Goodreads listings, and anonymous committee translations are forbidden. Every source MUST include `astronomical_component` and `component_reasoning`. `citation_status` MUST be `locked` (≤25-word quoted text + locator like 'Reading 5749-14') OR `provisional` (location_hint + summary). All sources MUST include `source_type`, `year`, `original_year`, `publisher`, and (if possible) `isbn`. You MUST still produce JSON even if many sources are provisional.

human_design_foundations: I Ching - 3,000+ years of scholarship (Wilhelm, Legge, Jung)
64 DNA codons - Nobel Prize research (Nirenberg, Khorana 1968)
Chakra system - Religious Studies / Yoga Studies (Feuerstein)
mathematical_correspondences: Binary yin/yang logic = Binary genetic code (A/T, C/G)

characteristics.trait: Arcturus as a soul-gate / transit node for consciousness between incarnations

sources.title: Reading 5749-14
sources.author: Edgar Cayce
sources.publisher: A.R.E. Press / Association for Research and Enlightenment
sources.quote: Arcturus is that which may be called the center of this universe, through which individuals pass
sources.component_reasoning: Describes Arcturus as a universal center/gateway through which souls pass, implying a transit checkpoint for incarnational routing beyond/into Earth's system.

sources.title: Planetary Influences and Sojourns
sources.author: Edgar Cayce
sources.publisher: A.R.E. Press / Association for Research and Enlightenment
sources.location_hint: Chapter on Arcturus as star gate / planetary sojourn cycle
sources.summary: Summarizes Cayce's planetary sojourn material: souls travel through Arcturus between Earth lifetimes and other dimensional systems, treating Arcturus as the 'in and out' gate of the solar system.
sources.component_reasoning: Frames Arcturus as an entry/exit portal node for souls choosing their next evolutionary context. This is explicitly a gateway/portal function.

sources.title: We, the Arcturians
sources.author: Norma J. Milanovich
sources.location_hint: Introduction and early transmissions describing Arcturian mission
sources.summary: Positions the Arcturians as higher-dimensional intelligences guiding Earth's vibrational transition and assisting humans in choosing higher states of being as Earth shifts dimensions.
sources.component_reasoning: Presents Arcturians as custodians helping humanity traverse a dimensional threshold, functionally treating Arcturus as a transit corridor into a higher-density state.

characteristics.trait: Arcturian civilization as a healer collective using light, frequency, and consciousness recalibration

sources.title: We, the Arcturians
sources.author: Norma J. Milanovich
sources.location_hint: Chapters on fifth-dimensional consciousness and medical/emotional recalibration
sources.summary: Describes Arcturians as advanced healers who work with emotional, mental, and spiritual fields using frequency/light to elevate human vibration and assist in dimensional ascension.
sources.component_reasoning: Portrays Arcturians primarily as high-frequency healers offering vibrational tuning and trauma clearing; this matches the healing/frequency ('H') function rather than navigation or rulership.

sources.title: The Arcturian Anthology
sources.author: Tom Kenyon and Judi Sion
sources.location_hint: Sections describing the Arcturian Medical Officer, Re-Genesis Chamber, and vibrational healing practices
sources.summary: Presents Arcturian healers who use sound, resonance chambers, and conscious frequency entrainment to accelerate human energetic repair and spiritual evolution.
sources.component_reasoning: Defines Arcturus-linked beings as specialists in vibrational medicine and regeneration; aligns with the healing/recalibration code ('H').

characteristics.trait: Arcturus in ancient and classical material as a visible navigation/seasonal star, not a guardian civilization

sources.title: The Odyssey
sources.author: Homer
sources.summary: Odysseus is told to steer by keeping Boötes (the Bear-Guard, containing Arcturus) and the Bear in sight. The star is treated as a directional/seasonal marker for navigation.
sources.component_reasoning: Arcturus (bright K-type red giant in Boötes) is referenced as a visible guide star in the sky. No mention of gateways, healers, or councils — purely observational astronomy.

sources.title: The Book of Job
sources.author: Anonymous / Hebrew Bible
sources.location_hint: Job 38:32 (Alter translation; references to 'Ayish' / the Bear)
sources.summary: Mentions stellar groupings associated with the Bear / Ayish. Later English traditions sometimes map 'Ayish' to Arcturus, treating it as a known bright seasonal star rather than a metaphysical authority.
sources.component_reasoning: The star/constellation reference is seasonal and positional. Arcturus is treated as a sky object, not as sentient guardianship.

sources.title: Stars and Their Spectra: An Introduction to the Spectral Sequence
sources.author: James B. Kaler
sources.location_hint: Chapter discussing K-type red giant stars, including Arcturus
sources.summary: Describes Arcturus as a K1.5III red giant ~36.7 light-years from Earth, ~25 solar radii and ~170x solar luminosity. Treated as a normal evolved star within stellar astrophysics.
sources.component_reasoning: Purely physical/astronomical description of Arcturus as an observable red giant star. Explicitly does not assign portal, healing, or civilization behavior.

disputed_points.claim: Arcturus functions as an interdimensional gateway that all or most human souls must pass through between incarnations, where a council helps them select their next evolutionary path.

supporting_sources.title: Reading 5749-14
supporting_sources.author: Edgar Cayce
supporting_sources.publisher: A.R.E. Press / Association for Research and Enlightenment
supporting_sources.quote: Arcturus is that which may be called the center of this universe, through which individuals pass
supporting_sources.component_reasoning: Frames Arcturus as a transit hub or adjudication node for souls — a literal 'pass-through' point.

supporting_sources.title: We, the Arcturians
supporting_sources.author: Norma J. Milanovich
supporting_sources.location_hint: Introductory chapters describing Arcturian councils and dimensional transition work
supporting_sources.summary: Describes Arcturians as guiding Earth into higher-dimensional states and assisting beings in choosing whether to remain with Earth or move onward. Positions Arcturus-linked councils as gatekeepers of transition.
supporting_sources.component_reasoning: Supports the notion that Arcturus is a 'dimensional transfer station' or ascension checkpoint.

counter_evidence.title: Stars and Their Spectra: An Introduction to the Spectral Sequence
counter_evidence.author: James B. Kaler
counter_evidence.location_hint: Physical description of Arcturus' luminosity, radius, and distance
counter_evidence.summary: Treats Arcturus strictly as a normal K1.5III red giant star ~36.7 light-years away. No discussion of gates, councils, incarnation selection, or soul adjudication.
counter_evidence.component_reasoning: Positions Arcturus as an evolved red giant with standard stellar properties. Implies the 'universal gateway' claim is not supported by astrophysics.

ancient_references: Classical and biblical-era materials (Homer's Odyssey navigation instructions via Boötes/'Bear Guard', and Job 38:32 references to Ayish/the Bear) treat Arcturus as a highly visible seasonal/navigation star. These sources do NOT present Arcturus as a healing civilization, council, or incarnational checkpoint. The idea of Arcturus as a sentient healer collective or interdimensional transit node emerges primarily in 20th-century and later channeled material with publisher imprint (e.g. Edgar Cayce readings from 1941 onward, Milanovich 1990, Kenyon 2014).
research_notes: v4.2 enforcement notes: (1) Every source includes publisher/imprint, year, original_year, ISBN/null, source_type, citation_status, astronomical_component, and component_reasoning. (2) 'locked' sources include ≤25-word direct quotes plus a locator (e.g. 'Reading 5749-14'). (3) 'provisional' sources include location_hint + summary when we cannot reproduce exact text. (4) Ancient texts must provide a named translator attached to a publisher imprint. (5) Arcturus gateway claims and Arcturian healer claims are retained but flagged as channeled and generally medium/low consensus with unknown or no ancient support. (6) Astronomy/astrophysics sources are included to provide counter-evidence, and are marked with astronomical_component:'A' to distinguish physical star description from metaphysical lore. (7) No blogs, personal domains, Wikipedia, or spiritual marketing pages are included.

ancient_texts: Homer. The Odyssey. Translator: Robert Fagles. Penguin Classics. (1996). Navigation by Boötes / Bear-Guard region (Arcturus as bright guide star).
The Book of Job 38:32. Translator: Robert Alter. W. W. Norton. (2010). References to Ayish / the Bear later associated in English tradition with Arcturus as a seasonal marker.
Classical Greek star lore: Arcturus identified as the bright star of Boötes, 'the Bear Guard', used for orientation in navigation and agriculture timing.
modern_research: Kaler, James B. (2011). Stars and Their Spectra: An Introduction to the Spectral Sequence (2nd ed.). Cambridge University Press. Describes Arcturus as a K1.5III red giant ~36.7 ly away, ~25 solar radii.
Association for Research and Enlightenment / Edgar Cayce Foundation archival framing of planetary sojourn material (2010 A.R.E. Press summaries) as interpretive context for reincarnation cosmology.
Comparative mythology / Human Design synthesis linking I Ching codon logic, chakra systems, and star myths to identity archetypes.
channeled_sources: Cayce, Edgar. Reading 5749-14 (1941). Republished by A.R.E. Press (2006). Positions Arcturus as a universal transit point for souls.
Cayce, Edgar. Planetary Influences and Sojourns. A.R.E. Press (2010). Summarizes Cayce's planetary sojourn model and treats Arcturus as an in/out gate of Earth's incarnation loop.
Milanovich, Norma J. (1990). We, the Arcturians. Athena Publishing. Presents Arcturians as higher-dimensional guides overseeing human vibrational transition.
Kenyon, Tom & Sion, Judi (2014). The Arcturian Anthology. Orb Communications. Describes Arcturian healer cadres using sound/frequency/re-generation chambers.
academic_foundations: Wilhelm, Richard & Baynes, Cary F. (1950/1967). The I Ching. Princeton University Press.
Nirenberg, Marshall W. & Khorana, Har Gobind (1968). Nobel-recognized genetic code research connecting codons to amino acids.
Scholem, Gershom (1941). Major Trends in Jewish Mysticism.
Feuerstein, Georg (1998). The Yoga Tradition. Yoga Studies / continuum of subtle-body maps.
Tarnas, Richard (2006). Cosmos and Psyche. Cultural/astrological cycles framed as meaning-bearing.
